intro: Conophytum decoratum, commonly known as the "Cape snowflake," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-shaped growth habit. The plant features fleshy, triangular leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple during the summer months. Conophytum decoratum is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
